newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-ZIEGE AND STRUNZ PULL OUT OF GERMAN TEAM.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ZIEGE AND STRUNZ PULL OUT OF GERMAN TEAM.

text.p: Germany's already-depleted squad was further hit on Monday when Christian Ziege and Thomas Strunz pulled out of the trip to Armenia for their opening World Cup qualifer with knee and back injuries.
The European champions were already without several key players from their Euro 96 campaign including Borussia Dortmund libero Matthias Sammer and Bayern Munich defender Thomas Helmer.
But now coach Berti Vogts has been forced to re-arrange his defence following the withdrawl of Ziege and Strunz.
Dortmund veteran Juergen Kohler, who missed most of the Euro 96 finals because of injury, is expected to take over as sweeper.
Vogts has four uncapped players in his squad and may give Borussia Moenchengladbach's defensive midfielder Stephan Passlack his international debut.
